meanings.definition: A subtle or secondary color or shade in a painting or photograph.
meanings.sent1: The artist used undertints of blue to create a calming atmosphere in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The photograph had undertints of green that added depth to the overall composition.
meanings.sent3: The undertints of red in the painting seemed to play a secret game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had undertints of warmth that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The undertints of purple in the sunset made the sky look like a painting.

meanings.definition: A hint or suggestion of something.
meanings.sent1: There was an undertint of mischief in his playful grin.
meanings.sent2: Her words carried an undertint of sadness that touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent3: The undertint of chocolate in the cake made it irresistible to resist.
meanings.sent4: His apology had an undertint of insincerity that was hard to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The undertint of excitement in her voice hinted at good news to come.
